metadata.title: CVE-2015-7703 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The "pidfile" or "driftfile" directives in NTP ntpd 4.2.x before 4.2.8p4,and 4.3.x before 4.3.77, when ntpd is configured to allow remoteconfiguration, allows remote attackers with an IP address that is allowedto send configuration requests, and with knowledge of the remoteconfiguration password to write to arbitrary files via the :config command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7703` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.5
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.5').
